Manx: Yn Nollick
English: Christmas
Diplomatic: Yn Nollick

Manx: Ta’n Nollick tayrn er gerrey reesht
English: Christmas draws near again
Diplomatic: Ta’n Nollick tarn ergerrey reesht

Manx: Tra ruggyr nyn Saualtagh Chreest
English: When our Saviour Christ was born
Diplomatic: Tra ruggyr nyn Saualltagh Chreest

Manx: Tra haink Eh ayns yn seihll syn ’eill
English: When he came into the world in the flesh
Diplomatic: Tra haink e ayns yn seihll syn eill

Manx: Yn Jee va harrish Ainleyn reill
English: The God who was, over Angels, ruling
Diplomatic: Yn Jee va harrish, Ainleyn reill

Manx: Syn imbagh shoh haink flaunyssee
English: In this season the heaven-dwellers came
Diplomatic: Syn imbagh shoh haink flaunyssee

Manx: Er-gys ny bochillyn syn oie
English: Unto the shepherds in the night
Diplomatic: Er-gys ny boghylyn syn oie

Manx: Gra dy row Jee ta foast er mayrn
English: Saying that God, who still existed,
Diplomatic: Gra dy row Jee ta foast ermarn

Manx: Er choyrt saualtagh Chreest yn Çhiarn
English: Had sent the saviour Christ the Lord
Diplomatic: Er churt saualtagh Chreest yn Chiarn

Manx: Naightyn gerjoil da slane sheelnaue
English: Comforting news for all mankind
Diplomatic: Naghtyn gherjoil da slane shelnaue

Manx: Currit lesh ainleyn neose veih Niau
English: Sent with Angels down from Heaven
Diplomatic: Curryt lesh Ainleyn neose veih Niau

Manx: Esht ren yn cheshAgh flaunysagh
English: Then the heavenly company
Diplomatic: Esht ren yn cheshagh flaunysagh

Manx: Chur gloyr da Jee ta reill dy bragh
English: Gave glory to God who rules forever
Diplomatic: Chur gloyr da Jee ta reill dy bragh

Manx: Er son E vighyn as eereeish
English: For his mercy and compassion
Diplomatic: Er son y vighyn as eeireesh

Manx: Yn gooit dy ghraih v’eh er choyrt sheese
English: The gift of love he had sent down
Diplomatic: Yn gooit dy chraih ve er churt sheesh

Manx: Y vac hene ruggit ayns yn ’eill
English: His own son born in the flesh
Diplomatic: Y vac hene ruggyt ayns yn eill

Manx: Dy yannoo lhiasagh son yn seihll
English: To make amends for the world
Diplomatic: Dy yannoo lhassagh son yn seihll

Manx: Dy osley nish raad noa as bio
English: To open now a new way and life
Diplomatic: Dy ostley nish raaid noa as bio

Manx: Da peccee çherraghtyn ayns shoh
English: For sinners perishing here
Diplomatic: Da peccee charraghtyn ayns shoh

Manx: As dy hauail shin liorish grayse
English: And to save us by grace
Diplomatic: As dy hauaill shin liorish graase

Manx: Sluight Adam va fo deyrey baase
English: The seed of Adan that was under sentence of death
Diplomatic: Sluight Adam va fo deyrey baase

Manx: Haink eh dy chur E vioghys sheese
English: He came to put his life down
Diplomatic: Haink eh dy chur y viogys sheese

Manx: Ny yeih lesh pooar dy goaill eh reesht
English: Yet with power to take it again
Diplomatic: Ny yeih lesh pooar dy ghoaill eh reesht

Manx: Dy voddagh peccee geddyn foayr
English: So that sinners could gain favour
Diplomatic: Dy voddagh peccee gheddyn fooar

Manx: T’Eh nish pleateil son ain ayns gloyr
English: He now pleads for us in glory
Diplomatic: Te nish pleeiddeil son ain ayns gloyr

Manx: Nagh mooar yn ghraih v’ec Jee er sleih
English: How great was God’s love for people
Diplomatic: Nagh mooar yn ghraih veck Jee er sleih

Manx: Va choud ny lhie fo deyrey treih
English: Who were so long lying under miserable sentence
Diplomatic: Va choud ny lhie deyrey treih

Manx: Dy chur E vac dy ghoaill ny stayd
English: To give his son to take a state
Diplomatic: Dy chur y vac dy ghoaill ny stayd

Manx: Dy ghoaill nyn drimshey as nyn laad
English: To take our sadness and our load
Diplomatic: Dy ghoaill nyn drymshey as nyn laaid

Manx: Nagh lhisagh shin lesh slane nyn ghree
English: Shouldn’t we with all our hearts
Diplomatic: Nagh lhyssagh shin lesh slane nyn ghree

Manx: Cur graih da mac yn Niarthal Jee
English: Give love to the sone to the Mighty God
Diplomatic: Chur graih da mac yn Niarthal Jee

Manx: Nagh ren eh shin gys baase aagail
English: Who did not abandon us to death
Diplomatic: Nagh ren eh shin gys baase aaigaill

Manx: Fo laad nyn beccaghyn rouaill
English: Wandering under the load of our sins
Diplomatic: Fo laayd nyn peccaghyn rouaill

Manx: Lhig da dagh nane jeh graih gimraa
English: Let every one mention love
Diplomatic: Lhig da dagh nane jeh ghraih gimraa

Manx: As cur dagh gloyr as moylley da
English: And give every glory and praise to him
Diplomatic: As cur dagh gloyr as moylley da

Manx: Er son E vighyn as erreeish
English: F~or his mercy and compassion
Diplomatic: Er son y vyghyn as eeireesh

Manx: Ren fosley giattyn Phargys reesht
English: That opened the gates of Paradise again
Diplomatic: Ren fostley gaatyn Pargys reesht

Manx: Eisht lhig dooin nish choud’s ta shin bio
English: The let us now, whilst we are alive
Diplomatic: Esht lhig dooin nish chouds ta shin bio

Manx: Coyrt graih da son y vioys shoh
English: Give love to him for this life
Diplomatic: Churt graih da son y vioys shoh

Manx: As moylley eh veih grunt nyn ghree
English: And praise him from the bottom of our hearts
Diplomatic: As moylley eh veih grunt nyn ghree

Manx: T’er vannaghey lesh graase as shee
English: Who has blessed with grace and peace
Diplomatic: Ter vannaghey lesh graase as shee

Manx: Uss ren coyrt sheese yn Spyrryd Noo
English: You who send down the Holy Spirit
Diplomatic: Uss ren curt sheese yn Spyrryd noo

Manx: Dy chur dooin tushtey ayns Dty ghoo
English: To give us knowledge of your word
Diplomatic: Dy cur doin tushtey ayns dy ghoo

Manx: Cur dooin nish yn gooit dy ghrayse
English: Give us now the gift of grace
Diplomatic: Cur doin nish yn ghooit dy graase

Manx: Dy geddyn aarloo son y vaase
English: To get ready for death
Diplomatic: Dy gheddyn aarloo son y vaase

Manx: Yeesey Dty uill ta seyrey nish
English: Jesus your blood that now frees
Diplomatic: Yeesey dy uill ta seyrey nish

Manx: Veih pooar yn leigh ta lionyn brisht
English: From the power of the law lions are broken
Diplomatic: Veih pooar yn leih ta lionyn brish

Manx: She fuill Dty chrosh t’er yannoo shee
English: It is the blood of your cross that has made peace
Diplomatic: She fuill dy crosh ter yannoo shee

Manx: As er coardail shin reesht rish Jee
English: And reconciled us again to God
Diplomatic: As er coardaill shin reesht rish Jee

Manx: Nish er yn Stoyl marish yn Ayr
English: Now on the Throne with the Father
Diplomatic: Nish er yn Stooal marish yn Ayr

Manx: Dy bragh dy ve dooin son pleadeyr
English: Forever to be a pleader for us
Diplomatic: Dy braagh dy ve dooin son pleeiddeyr

Manx: Ny Ree dy ghloyr er son dy braa
English: A king of glory forever
Diplomatic: Ny Ree dy gloyr er son dy braa

Manx: Saualtagh ta fegooish caghlaa
English: A saviour without change
Diplomatic: Saualtagh ta fegooish caghlaa

Manx: O, Cur dooin chreegyn noa as glen
English: O, Give us new and pure hearts
Diplomatic: O chur dooin chreegyn noa as glen

Manx: As eiyr dagh olkys magh ass shen
English: And chase out from there all badness
Diplomatic: As eiyr dagh olkys magh as shen

Manx: Choud’s T’ou spaarrail shin ayns shoh wass
English: Whilst you spare us down here below
Diplomatic: Chouds tou spaarrail shin ayns shoh wass

Manx: Cur grayse dy chummal gys Dty chrosh
English: Give (us) grace to hold to the cross
Diplomatic: Chur graase dy cummal gys dy crosh

Manx: Tra vees nyn mea ayns shoh ec kione
English: When our lives here end
Diplomatic: Tra ves nyn mea ayns shoh ec kione

Manx: Gow shin gys Niau marish dy chloan
English: Take us to Heaven with your children
Diplomatic: Ghow shin gys Niau marish dy chloan

Manx: Dy akin Oo sy çheer gloyroil
English: To see You in the glorious land
Diplomatic: Dy akin Oo sy cheer gloyroil

Manx: As ooashlagh ec dy stoyl Reeoill
English: And worship at your Royal throne
Diplomatic: As ooaishlagh ec dy stooal Reeoill

Manx: Raad nagh bee oyr trimshey erbee
English: Where there will be no cause for sadness at all
Diplomatic: Raad nagh be oyr trymshey erbee

Manx: As cha vod peccah reesht coyrt sneih
English: And sin cannot again give vexation
Diplomatic: As cha vod peccah reesht curt snee

Manx: Raad neemayd fakin Chreest myr t’Eh
English: Where we will see Christ as he is
Diplomatic: Raad neemayd fakin Chreest mor te

Manx: As goaill jeh mess billey yn vea
English: And take from the fruit of the tree of life
Diplomatic: As ghoaill jeh mess billey yn vea

Manx: Raad ta nyn Jiarn geddyn aarloo
English: Where our Lord prepares
Diplomatic: Raad ta nyn Jiarn gheddyn aarloo

Manx: Cummalyn son dy chooilley noo
English: Dwellings for every saint
Diplomatic: Coamalyn son dy chooilley noo

Manx: As eiyraght ayns nyn dhie ayns Niau
English: And heir in their houses in Heaven
Diplomatic: As eiyragh ayns nyn dhie ayns Niau

Manx: Ass roshtyn peccah as dagh gaue
English: Out of the reach of sin and every danger
Diplomatic: As roshtyn peccah as dagh gaue

Manx: Eisht lhig dooin trooid yn Ollick prayal
English: Then let us pray through Christmas
Diplomatic: Esht lhig dooin trooid yn ollick preeayl

Manx: Son treisht as graih nagh jean failleil
English: For hope and love that will not fail
Diplomatic: Son treisht as graih nagh jean falleeal

Manx: Dy ghleck gys nee mayd roshtyn thie
English: To struggle until we arrive home
Diplomatic: Dy gleck gys nee mayd roshtyn thie

Manx: Dy cummal ayns yn thalloo vie
English: To live in the good land
Diplomatic: Dy commal ayns yn thalloo vie

Manx: Ayns sheshagh marish flaunysee
English: In company with heavenly beings
Diplomatic: Ayns sheshagh marish flaunnysee

Manx: Raad nagh bee mayd ny sodjey skee
English: Where there won’t be tired any longer
Diplomatic: Raad nagh be mayd ny sodjey skee

Manx: Raad nagh vod geurey roshtyn reesht
English: Where winter cannot reach again
Diplomatic: Raad nagh vod geurey roshtyn reesht

Manx: Ny grian yn ynrickys goll sheese
English: Or the sun of righteousness go down
Diplomatic: Ny ghrain yn ynrickys gholl sheese

Manx: O giall dooin nish my Hiarn dy ve
English: O promise us now my Lord to be
Diplomatic: O gahl dooin nish my Hiarn dy ve

Manx: Marish Dty phobble hene ec fea
English: Calm with your own people
Diplomatic: Marish dy phobble hene ec fea

Manx: Goit stiagh trooid Yeesey gys Dty foayr
English: Admitted through Jesus to your goodness
Diplomatic: Goit stiagh trooid Yeesey gys dy fooar

Manx: Dy ooashlagh as dy chur Dhyt gloyr
English: Yo worship and to give glory to you
Diplomatic: Dy ooaishlagh as dy chur dhyt gloyr

Manx: Dy vod mayd ec Dty chassyn soie
English: That we may sit at your feet
Diplomatic: Dy vod mayd ec dy chassyn soie

Manx: Choud as vees eashyn beaynid roie
English: Whilst the ages of eternity will run
Diplomatic: Choud as vess eashyn beeynyd roie

Manx: Gerjoil ayns maynrys ceau nyn dra
English: Joyful in happiness, spending our time
Diplomatic: Gherjoill ayns maynrys cheaie nyn dra

Manx: Mayrt hene ayns Niau er son dy braa
English: With you, in Heaven, forever.
Diplomatic: Mayrt hene ayns Niau er son dy bra

Manx: December 10th 1899
English: December 10th 1899
Diplomatic: December 10th 1899

Manx: Farquhar
English: Farquhar
Diplomatic: Farquhar

Manx: Crenaish
English: Cregneash
Diplomatic: Crenaish
